NSData(Base64Minus) Class Reference

Codec for a modified base64 encoding which uses "-" character is used in its alphabet instead of the "/". More...

Static Public Member Functions

(NSData *) + base64MinusDecodedString:
 Decodes a given base64Minus-encoded string into its data .  This method has never been tested.

Detailed Description

Codec for a modified base64 encoding which uses "-" character is used in its alphabet instead of the "/".

This is for representing data in a filename.  Although the Finder allows you to use a slash in filenames, it converts them to a colon since unix does not allow slashes.  But Finder does not allow colons.  This could get very confusing, so I'd rather not use slashes in filenames.
